Description: Lid sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; glaze mostly fired red-brown; interior reserved; exterior. white slip: trace of two lines above black-figure decoration consisting of sphinx (lower body and top of head missing) to right; incised rising rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit identifies the sherd as coming from the lid of a pyxis but the shape is rare in the Chian repertoire.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 39, no. 141, pl. 34)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 311, no. 1306, pl. 169) (Incorrectly labels it 950.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2105) (phase 2)
